alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 11:39AM CDT until August 05 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in southeast Iowa, Lee. In northeast Missouri, Clark. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 AM CDT, local law enforcement continues to report many roads flooded across Clark and Lee counties. There has been some improvement but the flooding continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Madison, Keokuk, Kahoka, Nauvoo, West Point, Donnellson, Montrose, Wayland, Wyaconda, Alexandria, Franklin, Luray, St. Francisville, Croton, New Boston, Denmark, Winchester, Pontoosuc, Revere and Vincennes.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
